basics.name: Andres Otarola Alvarado
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
Engineer with +10 years of experience, I have worked with Nodejs, Ruby on Rails, PHP, Python, Groovy, Elm and Javascript for the most part of my career. Iâ€™ve work frameworks such as React, Preact, Django, and CakePHP.

I like type inference functional languages, my all time favorite is Elm, but I have a soft spot for Javascript. I like to tinker with my editor (nvim), and write my code at the speed of thought ðŸ˜‰.

During my career Iâ€™ve been in the frontend, backend, platform support (CI, cloud, third party integrations), and even email deliverability. Currently, Iâ€™m specializing in Platform/Frontend and Web performance.

Last but not least, I like to bake bread ðŸ¥– and brew kombucha, checkout some of my recipes at http://otarola.me

work.name: Groupon
work.summary:
Member of the Web Core Team
 - Architected and implemented web integration for Optimizely A/B testing service
 - Supported teams to migrate their on-prem services to the cloud and simplified core cloud configuration for Web.

work.name: Groupon
work.summary:
Tech lead of the checkout web team (purchase confirmation page) and user sessions team
 - Architected and implemented web and mobile integration with 3DS2.0
 - Complete overhaul to login/signup web application, thus making it meet business' performance goals

work.name: Groupon
work.summary:
Tech lead of the checkout web team (purchase confirmation page)
 - Refactored confirmation/receipt page (UX-wise, CSS and JS was remade)
 - Led touch redesign project for confirmation page, frontend stack: redux & preact
 - Migrated our integration testing browser agent from PhantomJS to headless chrome. 
 - Building and leading magic link implementation as an alternate authentication method
 - Migrated our logging searches from Splunk to ELK
 - Integrated ELK searches into Wavefront

work.name: Groupon
work.summary:
User Workflow Team (Chicago Team) - Software Engineer - NodeJs/Ruby

Responsibilities:
- Develop a NodeJs application using an in-house Framework to migrate current Monolithic App (Ruby on Rails) to a pool of distributed apps
- The apps that I worked on were: Checkout, My account and Login/SignUp/Password Reset (all in NodeJs)
- Modified current API frontend to enable some endpoints that needed to talk with our NodeJs apps, this API was written in Ruby On Rails (needed for the migration)
- Participated in the migration for US/Canada, and also in the EMEA migration for our apps
- Modified current API frontend to be ready to serve all deal types for a specific multi item endpoint for our checkout application (needed to allow checkout to take over for goods deal for US)
